summary.raw:
Remove preprocessor definition of BUILDING_DLL

The BUILDING_DLL macro is not used anywhere in the Gazebo source,
so it should not be necessary to define it for any reason.
Furthermore, in Windows the BUILDING_DLL macro in sdformat and in all
the ign-* projects is used to define the respective <PROJECT_NAME>_VISIBLE
macros to be equal  to __declspec(dllexport).
For this reason, defining the BUILDING_DLL macro is actually harmful
because in all the sdformat/ign-* headers that are included
by Gazebo, the <PROJECT_NAME>_VISIBLE macros will be equal to
__declspec(dllexport) rather then the intended __declspec(dllimport).
Note that in a sense this is a bug of both Gazebo, bucause it defines
the BUILDING_DLL, and of all sdformat/ign-* projects, that use a common
macro to switch their visible macro to be __declspec(dllexport), while
each one should instead use a project-specific macro.
summary.html:
Remove preprocessor definition of BUILDING_DLL

The BUILDING_DLL macro is not used anywhere in the Gazebo source,
so it should not be necessary to define it for any reason.
Furthermore, in Windows the BUILDING_DLL macro in sdformat and in all
the ign-* projects is used to define the respective <PROJECT_NAME>_VISIBLE
macros to be equal to declspec(dllexport).
For this reason, defining the BUILDING_DLL macro is actually harmful
because in all the sdformat/ign-* headers that are included
by Gazebo, the <PROJECT_NAME>_VISIBLE macros will be equal todeclspec(dllexport) rather then the intended declspec(dllimport).
Note that in a sense this is a bug of both Gazebo, bucause it defines
the BUILDING_DLL, and of all sdformat/ign-* projects, that use a common
macro to switch their visible macro to be declspec(dllexport), while
each one should instead use a project-specific macro.

values.message:
Remove preprocessor definition of BUILDING_DLL

The BUILDING_DLL macro is not used anywhere in the Gazebo source,
so it should not be necessary to define it for any reason.
Furthermore, in Windows the BUILDING_DLL macro in sdformat and in all
the ign-* projects is used to define the respective <PROJECT_NAME>_VISIBLE
macros to be equal  to __declspec(dllexport).
For this reason, defining the BUILDING_DLL macro is actually harmful
because in all the sdformat/ign-* headers that are included
by Gazebo, the <PROJECT_NAME>_VISIBLE macros will be equal to
__declspec(dllexport) rather then the intended __declspec(dllimport).
Note that in a sense this is a bug of both Gazebo, bucause it defines
the BUILDING_DLL, and of all sdformat/ign-* projects, that use a common
macro to switch their visible macro to be __declspec(dllexport), while
each one should instead use a project-specific macro.
